result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac A Edgelston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 4/10/2018; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges and assessments by 4/10/2018; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to 14CF4440 and consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 35 days time served.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also, he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac A Edgelston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a read-in on COUNT 1.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to COUNT 1 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to 14CF4440 and consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 35 days time served.  
Court ordered defendant pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 4/10/2018; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges and assessments by 4/10/2018; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also, he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 4/10/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Geographic: W. North St. to W. Lloyd St. and N. 16th St. to N. 17th St., Milwaukee WI.

Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in court with Robert Meyeroff for attorney Scott Phillips. Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in custody. Paul Hauer for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Isaac A Edgelston in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guiltyTO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
